question: A juggler can juggle {n} balls. A fraction {frac_1} of the balls are {ball_type} balls, and the rest are {ball_type2} balls. A fraction {frac_2} of the {ball_type} balls are {color}, of which a fraction {frac_3} are marked. A fraction {frac_22} of the {ball_type2} balls are {color2}, and all except a fraction {frac_33} of those {color2} balls are marked. How many marked balls are there in total?
answer: int(n * frac_1 * frac_2 * frac_3) + int(n * (1-frac_1) * frac_22 * (1-frac_33))
